channel.title: Startup School (2019) on My Second Brain
channel.description: Recent content in Startup School (2019) on My Second Brain

item.title: How to Evaluate Your Startup Ideas
item.description: How to Evaluate Your Startup Ideas Before anyone can remember, they have to understand - (Kevin Hale) Notes from Kevin Hale’s talk as part of Y Combinator’s Startup School 2019 Series. Original Videos : Part 1, Part 2 Table of Contents How to Evaluate Your Startup Ideas A Common Misconception about Investors Startup Ideas What constitute an idea? Beliefs Presenting Ideas to Investors Building a Pitch Deck Presenting the Idea Evaluating Investor Reactions: Memorable Quotes A Common Misconception about Investors A (good) investor’s job is not to figure out what’s wrong with the company, but how it could possibly win.

item.title: How to Talk to Users
item.description: How to Talk to Users Customers don’t buy the what. They buy the why - (Eric Migicovsky) Notes from Eric Migicovsky’s talk as part of Y Combinator’s Startup School 2019 Series. Original Video: here. General A good founder must maintain a direct connection to their users throughout the lifespan of the company in order to extract information from users. Users in general are not good at identifying the next feature they want.
